Start Producing Your Own Music in Ableton Live 11.

This tutorial is the first few sections taken from our Complete Ableton Live 11 Course. This course is all about Ableton Live 11, which is software for music sequencing and is a digital audio workstation for Windows and OS X.

Ableton Live is used across professional studios, bedroom studios and also as a performance tool for live performance. Learning how to use your DAW correctly will dramatically improve the quality of your music and the speed you create it.

NOTE: This YouTube tutorial is for all version of Ableton Live 11 (Lite, Intro, Standard, and Suite). Some of the features I discuss in our Complete Course will only be available for Ableton Live 11 Standard and Suite.

What is this Ableton Live 11 Tutorial all about?
In this beginners guide to Ableton Live 11, you will gain a basic overview of some of the main functions and features in Ableton Live.
This FL Studio video covers such topics as : 

✅ Understanding the Basics of Ableton Live 11
✅ A Brief Look a the Workflow of the Session View
✅ A Quick Overview of Creating Clips
✅ Brief Look at Writing MIDI
✅ Basic Audio Editing in Live 11
✅ How to Export your Music out of Ableton Live

Our Complete Ableton Live 11 Course goes into A LOT more detail than this video, and it's 20+ hours long!

snippet.title: How To Make Chords In Ableton Live 11 For Beginners | ABLETON LIVE 11 TUTORIAL
snippet.description:
How To Make Chords In Ableton Live 11 For Beginners | ABLETON LIVE 11 TUTORIAL

In this video we have a look at making chords in Ableton 11. This Ableton Live 11 tutorial will help you make chord progressions in Ableton & also will show you how to improve as a music producer. 

Thanks for watching!

🔴 Subscribe for more videos: https://bit.ly/3oI6tjA 👈👈

📩 Join the mailing list here: https://bit.ly/35K2HxC 👈👈

Chord progressions in Ableton are super easy to do with the 3 formulas mentioned. You can use these formulas as a base to start creating more complex chord progressions. One of Ableton 11 new features is the scale mode in the piano roll and this can be super helpful for scale navigation if you get stuck. After this video, you won't have to use any midi pack to help you with chords and no more looking for free midi packs either!

snippet.title: Ableton Live 11 101: Ableton Live 11 Beginner's Guide - Audio and MIDI Setup
snippet.description:
Additional videos for this title: https://j.mp/3rQoJJ2
Ableton Live 11 101: Ableton Live 11 Beginner's Guide by Rishabh Rajan
Video 2 of 38 for Ableton Live 11 101: Ableton Live 11 Beginner's Guide

Ableton Live is one of the most popular and unique digital audio workstations for electronic musicians. Now in its 11th iteration, Live has become a very deep program with quite a steep learning curve. That's why we've asked Ableton Certified Trainer Rishabh Rajan to create this easy-to-follow guide. If you're a beginner, this 38-tutorial course will show you absolutely everything you need to know to get you up and running with Ableton Live 11. The course is also an excellent refresher for more experienced users who are looking to understand Live better and discover new features introduced in the latest version.

The course begins with a detailed section on setting up your audio and MIDI settings for optimal performance, and an exploration of the Ableton Live 11 interface. Once everything  is configured, Rishabh moves on to explaining the difference between Session view and Arrangement view. He reveals how to use the flexible Browser, how to install packs, create MIDI and Audio tracks, and how to work with clips and scenes. Next, you dive deep into recording, editing, automation and arranging your music. As you continue your exploration of Ableton Live, you discover the new features introduced in Live 11 such as Note and Velocity Chance, new MIDI and audio effects, MPE, Take Recording and Comping, and more...

There's no better way to learn Ableton Live 11 than this Beginner's Guide. Join certified trainer Rishabh Rajan in this course now, and master Live 11 the right way!

More info on this title: https://j.mp/3rQoJJ2

snippet.title: Ableton Live 11 Tutorial part 2: Advanced features, Modulator Tool & Snapshot
snippet.description:
In part 2 of our new Ableton Live 11 tutorial series Rob uses some advanced features to add variety to a bass line. 

Download the Live 11 project & rack here: https://bit.ly/3rFY7Kg

Using the new LFO modulator tool in Live 11 Rob maps an LFO to his sample directly on the sample editor! You'll also see how to adjust the shape of the waveform and the LFO rate. Rob then adds everything to a rack, assigning different parameters to the macros. There's also a little look at another new feature 'Snapshot'.

snippet.title: How to Turn Your Loop into a Song – (6 Simple Steps)
snippet.description:
►► Download my FREE, step-by-step music finishing guide here: http://bit.ly/36yPd6o

If you have hundreds of 8 or 16 bar loops on your hard drive, the chances are you want to turn some of those into full songs, and actually finish your music.

Going from a loop to whole song arrangement is one of the BIGGEST problems I get asked about, so today I’m going to share with you 6 simple steps which will help you take your ideas into fully finished songs.

They might be chord progressions, melody ideas, beats or vocals. In this video I share with you 6 steps you can take to select the best bits, and then finish your music.

These techniques work for any style of music and in any music making software.

In this video you'll learn:

 1. Finding your best idea out of the hundreds languishing on your hard drive.
 2. Building it into a full loop with all the elements.
 3. We will be going into some common song structures and how to arrange your idea into a full song with a super-quick hack.
 4. We will also cover jamming along to add some interest - even if you can’t play an instrument!
 5. We will be covering a touch of sound design, adding vocals and mixing.
 6. AND we will be looking at how to add structural and dynamic interest to your arrangement.

Join our community of music producers here: https://www.facebook.com/EDMtipsOfficial/
